   21: -module(match_spec_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   24: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([test_1/1, test_2/1, test_3/1, test_4a/1, test_4b/1, test_5a/1,
   26:          test_5b/1, test_6/1, caller_and_return_to/1, bad_match_spec_bin/1,
   27: 	 trace_control_word/1, silent/1, silent_no_ms/1, silent_test/1,
   28: 	 ms_trace2/1, ms_trace3/1, ms_trace_dead/1, boxed_and_small/1,
   29: 	 destructive_in_test_bif/1, guard_exceptions/1,
   30: 	 empty_list/1,
   31: 	 unary_plus/1, unary_minus/1, moving_labels/1,
   32:          guard_bifs/1]).
   33: -export([fpe/1]).
   34: -export([otp_9422/1]).
   35: -export([faulty_seq_trace/1, do_faulty_seq_trace/0]).
   36: -export([maps/1]).
   37: -export([runner/2, loop_runner/3, fixed_runner/2]).
   38: -export([f1/1, f2/2, f3/2, fn/1, fn/2, fn/3]).
   39: -export([do_boxed_and_small/0]).
   40: -export([f1_test4/1, f2_test4/2, f3_test4/2]).
   41: 
   42: % This test suite assumes that tracing in general works. What we test is
   43: % the match spec functionality.
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   50: 
   51: all() ->
   52:     [test_1, test_2, test_3, test_4a, test_4b, test_5a, test_5b, test_6,
   53:      caller_and_return_to, bad_match_spec_bin,
   54:      trace_control_word, silent, silent_no_ms, silent_test, ms_trace2,
   55:      ms_trace3, ms_trace_dead, boxed_and_small, destructive_in_test_bif,
   56:      guard_exceptions, unary_plus, unary_minus, fpe,
   57:      moving_labels,
   58:      faulty_seq_trace,
   59:      empty_list,
   60:      otp_9422,
   61:      maps,
   62:      guard_bifs].
   63: 
   64: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   67:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   68: 
   69: test_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f1(a) end,
   71:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
   72:        [],
   73:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [a]}}]),
   74: 
   75:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
   76:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
   77:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[]}],
   78:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}}]),
   79: 
   80:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
   81:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
   82:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[{message, false}]}],
   83:        []),
   84: 
   85:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
   86:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
   87:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[{message, 4711}]}],
   88:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}, 4711}]),
   89: 
   90:     Ref = make_ref(),
   91:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(Ref, Ref) end,
   92:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
   93:        [{[Ref,'$1'],[{is_reference, '$1'}],[{message, 4711}]}],
   94:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [Ref, Ref]}, 4711}]),
   95:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(Ref, Ref) end,
   96:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
   97:        [{['$1',Ref],[{is_reference, '$1'}],[{message, 4711}]}],
   98:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [Ref, Ref]}, 4711}]),
   99: 
  100:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
  101:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  102:        [{['$0','$0'],[{is_atom, '$0'}],[{message, 4711}]}],
  103:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}, 4711}]),
  104: 
  105:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, b) end,
  106:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  107:        [{['_','_'],[],[]}],
  108:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, b]}}]),
  109: 
  110:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, b) end,
  111:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  112:        [{['_','_'],[],[{message, '$_'}]}],
  113:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, b]}, [a, b]}]),
  114: 
  115:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, '$_') end,
  116:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  117:        [{['$1','$_'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[]}],
  118:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, '$_']}}]),
  119: 
  120:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f1({a}) end,
  121:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  122:        [{['$1'],[{'==', '$1', {const, {a}}}],[]}],
  123:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [{a}]}}]),
  124: 
  125:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f1({a}) end,
  126:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  127:        [{['$1'],[{'==', '$1', {{a}}}],[]}],
  128:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [{a}]}}]),
  129: 
  130:     %% Undocumented, currently.
  131:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
  132:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  133:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[{message, 4711},
  134:                                         {message, true}]}],
  135:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}}]),
  136: 
  137:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
  138:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  139:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[{message, 4711},
  140:                                         {message, false}]}],
  141:        []),
  142: 
  143:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
  144:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  145:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[kakalorum]}],
  146:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}}]),
  147: 
  148:     %% Verify that 'process_dump' can handle a matchstate on the stack.
  149:     tr(fun() -> fbinmatch(<<0>>, 0) end,
  150:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  151:        [{['_'],[],[{message, {process_dump}}]}],
  152:        [fun({trace, _, call, {?MODULE, f1, [0]}, _Bin}) -> true end]),
  153: 
  154:     % Error cases
  155:     errchk([{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[{banka, kanin}]}]),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: test_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f2(a, a) end,
  160:        {?MODULE, f2, 2},
  161:        [{['$1','$1'],[{is_atom, '$1'}],[{return_trace}]}],
  162:        [{call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}},
  163:         {return_from, {?MODULE, f2, 2}, {a, a}}]),
  164:     ok.
  165: 
  166: %% Test the enable_trace/2 and caller/0 PAM instructions
  167: test_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  168:     Fun1 = fun() -> 
  169: 		   register(fnoppelklopfer,self()),
  170: 		   ?MODULE:f2(a, b),
  171: 		   ?MODULE:f2(a, b) 
  172: 	   end,
  173:     P1 = spawn(?MODULE, runner, [self(), Fun1]),
  174:     Pat = [{['$1','$1'],[],[{message,
  175:                              [{enable_trace, P1, call},{caller}]}]},
  176:            {['_','_'],[],[{message,
  177:                            [{disable_trace, fnoppelklopfer, call}]}]}],
  178:     Fun2 = fun() -> ?MODULE:f3(a, a) end,
  179:     P2 = spawn(?MODULE, runner, [self(), Fun2]),
  180:     erlang:trace(P2, true, [call]),
  181:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2, 2}, Pat),
  182:     collect(P2, [{trace, P2, call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, a]}, [true,
  183: 							     {?MODULE,f3,2}]}]),
  184:     collect(P1, [{trace, P1, call, {?MODULE, f2, [a, b]}, [true]}]),
  185:     ok.
  186: 
  187: %% Test `caller_line` trace with `call` and `global`
  188: test_4a(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  189:     Fun = fun() -> ?MODULE:f3_test4(a, b) end,
  190:     Pat = [{'_', [],[{message, {caller_line}}]}],
  191:     P = spawn(?MODULE, runner, [self(), Fun]),
  192:     erlang:trace(P, true, [call]),
  193:     %% `global` is implied but we still mention explicitly
  194:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test4, 2}, Pat, [global]),
  195:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test4, 1}, Pat, [global]),
  196:     collect(P, [{trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f2_test4, [a, b]}, {?MODULE, f3_test4, 2, {"test4.erl", 3}}},
  197:                 {trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f1_test4, [a]}, {?MODULE, f3_test4, 2, {"test4.erl", 3}}}]),
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: %% Test `caller_line` trace with `return_trace`, `call` and `global`
  201: test_4b(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  202:     Fun = fun() -> ?MODULE:f3_test4(a, b) end,
  203:     P = spawn(?MODULE, runner, [self(), Fun]),
  204:     Pat = [{'_', [], [{return_trace}, {message, {caller_line}}]}],
  205:     erlang:trace(P, true, [call]),
  206:     %% `global` is implied but we still mention explicitly
  207:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test4, 2}, Pat, [global]),
  208:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test4, 1}, Pat, [global]),
  209:     collect(P, [{trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f2_test4, [a, b]}, {?MODULE, f3_test4, 2, {"test4.erl", 3}}},
  210:                 {trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f1_test4, [a]}, {?MODULE, f3_test4, 2, {"test4.erl", 3}}},
  211:                 {trace, P, return_from, {?MODULE, f1_test4, 1}, {a}},
  212:                 {trace, P, return_from, {?MODULE, f2_test4, 2}, {a}}
  213:                ]),
  214:     ok.
  215: 
  216: %% Test `caller_line` trace with `call` and `local`
  217: test_5a(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  218:     Fun = fun() -> f3_test5(a, b) end,
  219:     Pat = [{'_', [],[{message, {caller_line}}]}],
  220:     P = spawn(?MODULE, runner, [self(), Fun]),
  221:     erlang:trace(P, true, [call]),
  222:     %% Notice `local` function tracing
  223:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test5, 2}, Pat, [local]),
  224:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test5, 1}, Pat, [local]),
  225:     collect(P, [{trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f2_test5, [a, b]}, {?MODULE, f3_test5, 2, {"test5.erl", 3}}},
  226:                 {trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f1_test5, [a]}, {?MODULE, f3_test5, 2, {"test5.erl", 3}}}]),
  227:     ok.
  228: 
  229: %% Test `caller_line` trace with `return_trace`, `call` and `local`
  230: test_5b(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  231:     Fun = fun() -> f3_test5(a, b) end,
  232:     P = spawn(?MODULE, runner, [self(), Fun]),
  233:     Pat = [{'_', [], [{return_trace}, {message, {caller_line}}]}],
  234:     erlang:trace(P, true, [call]),
  235:     %% Notice `local` function tracing
  236:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test5, 2}, Pat, [local]),
  237:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test5, 1}, Pat, [local]),
  238:     collect(P, [{trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f2_test5, [a, b]}, {?MODULE, f3_test5, 2, {"test5.erl", 3}}},
  239:                 {trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f1_test5, [a]}, {?MODULE, f3_test5, 2, {"test5.erl", 3}}},
  240:                 {trace, P, return_from, {?MODULE, f1_test5, 1}, {a}},
  241:                 {trace, P, return_from, {?MODULE, f2_test5, 2}, {a}}
  242:                ]),
  243:     ok.
  244: 
  245: %% Test current_stacktrace/[0,1]
  246: test_6(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  247:     %% Test non small argument
  248:     case catch erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test6, '_'},
  249:                                     [{'_', [], [{message, {current_stacktrace, a}}]}]) of
  250:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok;
  251:         Other1 -> ct:fail({noerror, Other1})
  252:     end,
  253: 
  254:     %% Test negative
  255:     case catch erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test6, '_'},
  256:                                     [{'_', [], [{message, {current_stacktrace, -1}}]}]) of
  257:         {'EXIT', {badarg, _}} -> ok;
  258:         Other2 -> ct:fail({noerror, Other2})
  259:     end,
  260: 
  261:     Fun = fun() -> f5_test6() end,
  262:     Pat = [{'_', [], [{message, {current_stacktrace}}]}],
  263:     P = spawn(?MODULE, fixed_runner, [self(), Fun]),
  264:     erlang:trace(P, true, [call]),
  265:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test6, 1}, Pat, [local]),
  266:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test6, 0}, Pat, [local]),
  267:     collect(P, [{trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f2_test6, [f1]},
  268:                    [
  269:                     {?MODULE, f3_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 21}]},
  270:                     {?MODULE, f5_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 14}]},
  271:                     {?MODULE, fixed_runner, 2, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 7}]}
  272:                    ]},
  273:                 {trace, P, call, {?MODULE, f1_test6, []},
  274:                    [
  275:                     {?MODULE, f2_test6, 1, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 25}]},
  276:                     {?MODULE, f3_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 21}]},
  277:                     {?MODULE, f5_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 14}]},
  278:                     {?MODULE, fixed_runner, 2, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 7}]}
  279:                    ]}
  280:                ]),
  281: 
  282:     Pat2 = [{'_', [], [{message, {current_stacktrace, 3}}]}],
  283:     P2 = spawn(?MODULE, fixed_runner, [self(), Fun]),
  284:     erlang:trace(P2, true, [call]),
  285:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test6, 1}, Pat2, [local]),
  286:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test6, 0}, Pat2, [local]),
  287:     collect(P2, [{trace, P2, call, {?MODULE, f2_test6, [f1]},
  288:                    [
  289:                     {?MODULE, f3_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 21}]},
  290:                     {?MODULE, f5_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 14}]},
  291:                     {?MODULE, fixed_runner, 2, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 7}]}
  292:                    ]},
  293:                 {trace, P2, call, {?MODULE, f1_test6, []},
  294:                    [
  295:                     {?MODULE, f2_test6, 1, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 25}]},
  296:                     {?MODULE, f3_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 21}]},
  297:                     {?MODULE, f5_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 14}]}
  298:                    ]}
  299:                ]),
  300: 
  301:     %% Test when erts_backtrace_depth is less than depth
  302:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 2),
  303:     try
  304:         P3 = spawn(?MODULE, fixed_runner, [self(), Fun]),
  305:         erlang:trace(P3, true, [call]),
  306:         erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2_test6, 1}, Pat2, [local]),
  307:         erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1_test6, 0}, Pat2, [local]),
  308:         collect(P3, [{trace, P3, call, {?MODULE, f2_test6, [f1]},
  309:                        [
  310:                         {?MODULE, f3_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 21}]},
  311:                         {?MODULE, f5_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 14}]}
  312:                        ]},
  313:                     {trace, P3, call, {?MODULE, f1_test6, []},
  314:                        [
  315:                         {?MODULE, f2_test6, 1, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 25}]},
  316:                         {?MODULE, f3_test6, 0, [{file, "test6.erl"}, {line, 21}]}
  317:                        ]}
  318:                    ])
  319:     after
  320:         erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth)
  321:     end,
  322: 
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: %% Test that caller and return to work as they should
  326: %% There was a bug where caller would be undefined when return_to was set
  327: %% for r the bif erlang:put().
  328: caller_and_return_to(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     tr(
  330:       fun do_put_wrapper/0,
  331:       fun (Tracee) ->
  332:               MsgCaller = [{'_',[],[{message,{caller}}]}],
  333:               1 = erlang:trace(Tracee, true, [call,return_to]),
  334:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,do_put,1}, MsgCaller, [local]),
  335:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,do_the_put,1}, MsgCaller, [local]),
  336:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {erlang,integer_to_list,1}, MsgCaller, [local]),
  337:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {erlang,put,2}, MsgCaller, [local]),
  338: 
  339:               [{trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,do_put,[test]},{?MODULE,do_put_wrapper,0}},
  340:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,do_the_put,[test]},{?MODULE,do_put,1}},
  341:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,integer_to_list,[1]},{?MODULE,do_the_put,1}},
  342:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,do_the_put,1}},
  343:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,put,[test,"1"]},{?MODULE,do_the_put,1}},
  344:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,do_the_put,1}},
  345:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,do_put,1}},
  346: 
  347:                %% These last trace messages are a bit strange...
  348:                %% if call tracing had been enabled for do_put_wrapper
  349:                %% then caller and return_to would have been {?MODULE,do_put_wrapper,1}
  350:                %% but since it is not, they are set to do_put instead, but we still
  351:                %% get the do_put_wrapper return_to message...
  352:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,integer_to_list,[2]},{?MODULE,do_put,1}},
  353:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,do_put,1}},
  354:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,do_put_wrapper,0}}
  355:               ]
  356:       end),
  357:     ok.
  358: 
  359: do_put_wrapper() ->
  360:     do_put(test),
  361:     ok.
  362: 
  363: do_put(Var) ->
  364:     do_the_put(Var),
  365:     erlang:integer_to_list(id(2)).
  366: do_the_put(Var) ->
  367:     Lst = erlang:integer_to_list(id(1)),
  368:     erlang:put(Var, Lst).
  369: 
  370: otp_9422(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     Laps = 10000,
  372:     Fun1 = fun() -> otp_9422_tracee() end,
  373:     P1 = spawn_link(?MODULE, loop_runner, [self(), Fun1, Laps]),
  374:     io:format("spawned ~p as tracee\n", [P1]),
  375: 
  376:     erlang:trace(P1, true, [call, silent]),
  377: 
  378:     Fun2 = fun() -> otp_9422_trace_changer() end,
  379:     P2 = spawn_link(?MODULE, loop_runner, [self(), Fun2, Laps]),
  380:     io:format("spawned ~p as trace_changer\n", [P2]),
  381: 
  382:     start_collect(P1),
  383:     start_collect(P2),
  384: 
  385:     %%receive after 10*1000 -> ok end,
  386: 
  387:     stop_collect(P1),
  388:     stop_collect(P2, abort),
  389:     ok.
  390:     
  391: otp_9422_tracee() ->
  392:     ?MODULE:f1(a),
  393:     ?MODULE:f1(b),
  394:     ?MODULE:f1(c).
  395: 
  396: otp_9422_trace_changer() ->
  397:     Pat1 = [{[a], [], [{enable_trace, arity}]}],
  398:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1, 1}, Pat1),
  399:     Pat2 = [{[b], [], [{disable_trace, arity}]}],
  400:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1, 1}, Pat2).
  401: 
  402:     
  403:     
  404: 
  405: 
  406: bad_match_spec_bin(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  407:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch ets:match_spec_run([1], <<>>)),
  408:     B0 = <<1,2>>,
  409:     {B,_} = split_binary(B0, 0),
  410:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch ets:match_spec_run([1], B)),
  411:     ok.
  412: 
  413: 
  414: 
  415: %% Test the erlang:system_info(trace_control_word) and
  416: %% erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, Value) BIFs,
  417: %% as well as the get_tcw/0 and set_tcw/1 PAM instructions
  418: trace_control_word(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  419:     32 = Bits = tcw_bits(),
  420:     High = 1 bsl (Bits - 1),
  421:     erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, 17),
  422:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f1(a) end,
  423:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  424:        [{'_',[{'=:=', {get_tcw}, 17}],[]}],
  425:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [a]}}]),
  426:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f1(a) end,
  427:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  428:        [{'_',[{'=:=', {get_tcw}, 18}],[]}],
  429:        []),
  430:     erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, High),
  431:     tr(fun() -> ?MODULE:f1(a) end,
  432:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  433:        [{'_',[{'=:=', {get_tcw}, High}],[]}],
  434:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [a]}}]),
  435:     erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, 0),
  436:     tr(fun() -> 
  437:                ?MODULE:f1(a), 
  438:                ?MODULE:f1(start), 
  439:                ?MODULE:f1(b), 
  440:                ?MODULE:f1(c), 
  441:                ?MODULE:f1(high), 
  442:                ?MODULE:f1(d),
  443:                ?MODULE:f1(stop), 
  444:                ?MODULE:f1(e) 
  445:        end,
  446:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  447:        [{[start],
  448:          [],
  449:          [{message, {set_tcw, 17}}]},
  450:         {[stop],
  451:          [],
  452:          [{message, {set_tcw, 0}}]},
  453:         {[high],
  454:          [],
  455:          [{message, {set_tcw, High}}]},
  456:         {['_'],
  457:          [{'>', {get_tcw}, 0}],
  458:          [{set_tcw, {'+', 1, {get_tcw}}}, {message, {get_tcw}}] }],
  459:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [start]}, 0},
  460:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [b]}, 18},
  461:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [c]}, 19},
  462:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [high]}, 19},
  463:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [d]}, High + 1},
  464:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [stop]}, High + 1}]),
  465:     0 = erlang:system_info(trace_control_word),
  466:     ok.
  467: 
  468: tcw_bits() ->
  469:     tcw_bits(erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, 0), 0, 0).
  470: 
  471: tcw_bits(Save, Prev, Bits) ->
  472:     Curr = 1 bsl Bits,
  473:     case catch erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, Curr) of
  474:         {'EXIT' , {badarg, _}} ->
  475:             Prev = erlang:system_flag(trace_control_word, Save),
  476:             Bits;
  477:         Prev ->
  478:             Curr = erlang:system_info(trace_control_word),
  479:             tcw_bits(Save, Curr, Bits+1)
  480:     end.
  481: 
  482: 
  483: %% Test the erlang:trace(_, _, [silent]) flag
  484: %% as well as the silent/0 PAM instruction
  485: silent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  486:     %% Global call trace
  487:     tr(fun() -> 
  488:                ?MODULE:f1(a),     % No trace - not active
  489:                ?MODULE:f1(miss),  % No trace - no activation
  490:                ?MODULE:f1(b),     % No trace - still not active
  491:                ?MODULE:f1(start), % Trace    - activation
  492:                ?MODULE:f1(c),     % Trace    - active
  493:                f1(d),             % No trace - local call
  494:                ?MODULE:f1(miss),  % Trace    - no inactivation
  495:                ?MODULE:f1(e),     % Trace    - still active
  496:                ?MODULE:f1(stop),  % No trace - inactivation
  497:                ?MODULE:f1(f)      % No trace - not active
  498:        end,
  499:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  500:        [call, silent],
  501:        [{[start],
  502:          [],
  503:          [{silent, false}, {message, start}]},
  504:         {[stop],
  505:          [],
  506:          [{silent, true}, {message, stop}]},
  507:         {[miss],
  508:          [],
  509:          [{silent, neither_true_nor_false}, {message, miss}]},
  510:         {['$1'],
  511:          [],
  512:          [{message, '$1'}] }],
  513:        [global],
  514:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [start]}, start},
  515:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [c]}, c},
  516:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [miss]}, miss},
  517:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [e]}, e} ]),
  518:     %% Local call trace
  519:     tr(fun() -> 
  520:                ?MODULE:f1(a),     % No trace - not active
  521:                f1(b),             % No trace - not active
  522:                ?MODULE:f1(start), % Trace    - activation
  523:                ?MODULE:f1(c),     % Trace    - active
  524:                f1(d),             % Trace    - active
  525:                f1(stop),          % No trace - inactivation
  526:                ?MODULE:f1(e),     % No trace - not active
  527:                f1(f)              % No trace - not active
  528:        end,
  529:        {?MODULE, f1, 1},
  530:        [call, silent],
  531:        [{[start],
  532:          [],
  533:          [{silent, false}, {message, start}]},
  534:         {[stop],
  535:          [],
  536:          [{silent, true}, {message, stop}]},
  537:         {['$1'],
  538:          [],
  539:          [{message, '$1'}] }],
  540:        [local],
  541:        [{call, {?MODULE, f1, [start]}, start},
  542:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [c]}, c},
  543:         {call, {?MODULE, f1, [d]}, d} ]),
  544:     ok.
  545: 
  546: %% Test the erlang:trace(_, _, [silent]) flag without match specs
  547: silent_no_ms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  548:     %% Global call trace
  549:     %%
  550:     %% Trace f2/2 and erlang:integer_to_list/1 without match spec
  551:     %% and use match spec on f1/1 to control silent flag.
  552:     tr(
  553:       fun () -> 
  554:               ?MODULE:f1(a),
  555:               ?MODULE:f2(b, c),
  556:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(1)),
  557:               ?MODULE:f3(d, e),
  558:               ?MODULE:f1(start),
  559:               ?MODULE:f2(f, g),
  560:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(2)),
  561:               ?MODULE:f3(h, i),
  562:               ?MODULE:f1(stop),
  563:               ?MODULE:f2(j, k),
  564:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(3)),
  565:               ?MODULE:f3(l, m)
  566:       end,
  567:       fun (Tracee) ->
  568:               1 = erlang:trace(Tracee, true, [call,silent,return_to]),
  569:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,f2,2}, [], [global]),
  570:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {erlang,integer_to_list,1}, [], [global]),
  571:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern(
  572:                     {?MODULE,f1,1},
  573:                     [{[start],[],[{silent,false}]},
  574:                      {[stop],[],[{silent,true}]}],
  575:                     [global]),
  576:               %%
  577:               %% Expected: (no return_to for global call trace)
  578:               %%
  579:               [{trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f1,[start]}},
  580:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[f,g]}},
  581:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,integer_to_list,[2]}},
  582:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[h,i]}}]
  583:       end),
  584:     %% Local call trace
  585:     %%
  586:     %% Trace f2/2 and erlang:integer_to_list/1 without match spec
  587:     %% and use match spec on f1/1 to control silent flag.
  588:     tr(
  589:       fun () -> 
  590:               ?MODULE:f1(a),
  591:               ?MODULE:f2(b, c),
  592:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(1)),
  593:               ?MODULE:f3(d, e),
  594:               ?MODULE:f1(start),
  595:               ?MODULE:f2(f, g),
  596:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(2)),
  597:               ?MODULE:f3(h, i),
  598:               ?MODULE:f1(stop),
  599:               ?MODULE:f2(j, k),
  600:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(3)),
  601:               ?MODULE:f3(l, m)
  602:       end,
  603:       fun (Tracee) ->
  604:               1 = erlang:trace(Tracee, true, [call,silent,return_to]),
  605:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,f2,2}, [], [local]),
  606:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {erlang,integer_to_list,1}, [], [local]),
  607:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern(
  608:                     {?MODULE,f1,1},
  609:                     [{[start],[],[{silent,false}]},
  610:                      {[stop],[],[{silent,true}]}],
  611:                     [local]),
  612:               %%
  613:               %% Expected:
  614:               %%
  615:               [{trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f1,[start]}},
  616:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,
  617:                 {?MODULE,'-silent_no_ms/1-fun-3-',0}},
  618:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[f,g]}},
  619:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,
  620:                 {?MODULE,'-silent_no_ms/1-fun-3-',0}},
  621:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,integer_to_list,[2]}},
  622:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,
  623:                 {?MODULE,'-silent_no_ms/1-fun-3-',0}},
  624:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[h,i]}},
  625:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,f3,2}}]
  626:       end).
  627: 
  628: %% Test that match_spec_test does not activate silent
  629: silent_test(_Config) ->
  630:     {flags,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),flags),
  631:     erlang:match_spec_test([],[{'_',[],[{silent,true}]}],trace),
  632:     {flags,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(),flags).

  635: %% Test the match spec functions {trace/2}
  636: ms_trace2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  637:     Tracer = self(),
  638:     %% Meta trace init
  639:     %%
  640:     %% Trace global f1/1, local f2/2, global erlang:integer_to_list/1
  641:     %% without match spec. Use match spec functions
  642:     %% {trace/2} to control trace through fn/2,3.
  643:     tr(
  644:       fun () -> 
  645:               ?MODULE:f1(a),
  646:               ?MODULE:f2(b, c),
  647:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(1)),
  648:               ?MODULE:f3(d, e),
  649:               fn([all], [call,return_to,{tracer,Tracer}]),
  650:               ?MODULE:f1(f),
  651:               f2(g, h),
  652:               f1(i),
  653:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(2)),
  654:               ?MODULE:f3(j, k),
  655:               fn([call,return_to], []),
  656:               ?MODULE:f1(l),
  657:               ?MODULE:f2(m, n),
  658:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(3)),
  659:               ?MODULE:f3(o, p)
  660:       end,
  661:       fun (Tracee) ->
  662:               1 = erlang:trace(Tracee, false, [all]),
  663:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,f1,1}, [], [global]),
  664:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,f2,2}, [], [local]),
  665:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {erlang,integer_to_list,1}, [], [global]),
  666:               3 = erlang:trace_pattern(
  667:                     {?MODULE,fn,'_'},
  668:                     [{['$1','$2'],[],
  669:                       [{trace,'$1','$2'},{message,ms_trace2}]}],
  670:                     [meta]),
  671:               %%
  672:               %% Expected: (no return_to for global call trace)
  673:               %%
  674:               Origin = {match_spec_SUITE,'-ms_trace2/1-fun-1-',1},
  675:               [{trace_ts,Tracee,call,
  676:                 {?MODULE,fn,
  677:                  [[all],[call,return_to,{tracer,Tracer}]]},
  678:                 ms_trace2},
  679:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f1,[f]}},
  680:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[g,h]}},
  681:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,Origin},
  682:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,integer_to_list,[2]}},
  683:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[j,k]}},
  684:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,f3,2}},
  685:                {trace_ts,Tracee,call,
  686:                 {?MODULE,fn,
  687:                  [[call,return_to],[]]},
  688:                 ms_trace2}]
  689:       end),
  690:     %% Silence valgrind
  691:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,fn,'_'},[],[]),
  692:     ok.
  693: 
  694: 
  695: 
  696: %% Test the match spec functions {trace/3}
  697: ms_trace3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  698:     TraceeName = 'match_spec_SUITE:ms_trace3',
  699:     Tracer = self(),
  700:     %% Meta trace init
  701:     %%
  702:     %% Trace global f1/1, local f2/2, global erlang:integer_to_list/1
  703:     %% without match spec. Use match spec functions
  704:     %% {trace/2} to control trace through fn/2,3.
  705:     Tag = make_ref(),
  706:     Controller =
  707:     spawn_link(
  708:       fun () ->
  709:               receive 
  710:                   {Tracee,Tag,start} ->
  711:                       fn(TraceeName, [all], 
  712:                          [call,return_to,send,'receive',
  713:                           {tracer,Tracer}]),
  714:                       Tracee ! {self(),Tag,started},
  715:                       receive {Tracee,Tag,stop_1} -> ok end,
  716:                       fn(Tracee, [call,return_to], []),
  717:                       Tracee ! {self(),Tag,stopped_1},
  718:                       receive {Tracee,Tag,stop_2} -> ok end,
  719:                       fn(Tracee, [all], []),
  720:                       Tracee ! {self(),Tag,stopped_2}
  721:               end
  722:       end),
  723:     tr(
  724:       fun () -> %% Action
  725:               register(TraceeName, self()),
  726:               ?MODULE:f1(a),
  727:               ?MODULE:f2(b, c),
  728:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(1)),
  729:               ?MODULE:f3(d, e),
  730:               Controller ! {self(),Tag,start},
  731:               receive {Controller,Tag,started} -> ok end,
  732:               ?MODULE:f1(f),
  733:               f2(g, h),
  734:               f1(i),
  735:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(2)),
  736:               ?MODULE:f3(j, k),
  737:               Controller ! {self(),Tag,stop_1},
  738:               receive {Controller,Tag,stopped_1} -> ok end,
  739:               ?MODULE:f1(l),
  740:               ?MODULE:f2(m, n),
  741:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(3)),
  742:               ?MODULE:f3(o, p),
  743:               Controller ! {self(),Tag,stop_2},
  744:               receive {Controller,Tag,stopped_2} -> ok end,
  745:               ?MODULE:f1(q),
  746:               ?MODULE:f2(r, s),
  747:               _ = erlang:integer_to_list(id(4)),
  748:               ?MODULE:f3(t, u)
  749:       end,
  750: 
  751:       fun (Tracee) -> %% Startup
  752:               1 = erlang:trace(Tracee, false, [all]),
  753:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,f1,1}, [], [global]),
  754:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {?MODULE,f2,2}, [], [local]),
  755:               1 = erlang:trace_pattern( {erlang,integer_to_list,1}, [], [global]),
  756:               3 = erlang:trace_pattern(
  757:                     {?MODULE,fn,'_'},
  758:                     [{['$1','$2','$3'],[],
  759:                       [{trace,'$1','$2','$3'},{message,Tag}]}],
  760:                     [meta]),
  761:               %%
  762:               %% Expected: (no return_to for global call trace)
  763:               %%
  764:               Origin = {match_spec_SUITE,'-ms_trace3/1-fun-2-',2},
  765:               [{trace_ts,Controller,call,
  766:                 {?MODULE,fn,[TraceeName,[all],
  767:                              [call,return_to,send,'receive',
  768:                               {tracer,Tracer}]]},
  769:                 Tag},
  770:                {trace,Tracee,'receive',{Controller,Tag,started}},
  771:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f1,[f]}},
  772:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[g,h]}},
  773:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,Origin},
  774:                {trace,Tracee,call,{erlang,integer_to_list,[2]}},
  775:                {trace,Tracee,call,{?MODULE,f2,[j,k]}},
  776:                {trace,Tracee,return_to,{?MODULE,f3,2}},
  777:                {trace,Tracee,send,{Tracee,Tag,stop_1},Controller},
  778:                {trace_ts,Controller,call,
  779:                 {?MODULE,fn,[Tracee,[call,return_to],[]]},
  780:                 Tag},
  781:                {trace_ts,Controller,call,
  782:                 {?MODULE,fn,[Tracee,[all],[]]},
  783:                 Tag}]
  784:       end),
  785:     ok.
  786: 
  787: %% Test that a dead tracer is removed using ms
  788: ms_trace_dead(_Config) ->
  789:     Self = self(),
  790:     TFun = fun F() -> receive M -> Self ! M, F() end end,
  791:     {Tracer, MRef} = spawn_monitor(TFun),
  792:     MetaTracer = spawn_link(TFun),
  793:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f1, '_'},
  794:                          [{'_',[],[{message, false},
  795:                                    {trace,[],
  796:                                     [call,{const,{tracer,Tracer}}]}]}],
  797:                          [{meta, MetaTracer}]),
  798:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2, '_'}, []),
  799:     ?MODULE:f2(1,2),
  800:     ?MODULE:f1(1),
  801:     {tracer,Tracer} = erlang:trace_info(self(), tracer),
  802:     {flags,[call]} = erlang:trace_info(self(), flags),
  803:     ?MODULE:f2(2,3),
  804:     receive {trace, Self, call, {?MODULE, f2, _}} -> ok end,
  805:     exit(Tracer, stop),
  806:     receive {'DOWN',MRef,_,_,_} -> ok end,
  807:     ?MODULE:f1(2),
  808:     {tracer,[]} = erlang:trace_info(self(), tracer),
  809:     ?MODULE:f2(3,4),
  810:     TRef = erlang:trace_delivered(all),
  811:     receive {trace_delivered, _, TRef} -> ok end,
  812:     receive M -> ct:fail({unexpected, M}) after 10 -> ok end.
  813: 
  814: %% Test that destructive operations in test bif does not really happen
  815: destructive_in_test_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  816:     {ok,OldToken,_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test
  817: 				([],
  818: 				 [{'_',[],[{message,{get_seq_token}}]}],trace),
  819:     {ok,_,_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test
  820: 			 ([],
  821: 			  [{'_',[],[{message,{set_seq_token, label, 1}}]}],
  822: 			  trace),
  823:     {ok,OldToken,_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test
  824: 				([],
  825: 				 [{'_',[],[{message,{get_seq_token}}]}],trace),
  826:     {ok, OldTCW,_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test
  827: 			       ([],[{'_',[],[{message,{get_tcw}}]}],trace),
  828:     {ok,OldTCW,_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test
  829: 			      ([],
  830: 			       [{'_',[],[{message,{set_tcw, OldTCW+1}}]}],
  831: 			       trace),
  832:     {ok, OldTCW,_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test
  833: 			       ([],[{'_',[],[{message,{get_tcw}}]}],trace),
  834:     ok.
  835: 
  836: %% Test that the comparison between boxed and small does not crash emulator
  837: boxed_and_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  838:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  839:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,do_boxed_and_small,[]),
  840:     peer:stop(Peer).
  841: 
  842: do_boxed_and_small() ->
  843:     {ok, false, _, _} = erlang:match_spec_test({0,3},[{{1.47,'_'},[],['$_']}],table),
  844:     {ok, false, _, _} = erlang:match_spec_test({0,3},[{{12345678901234567890,'_'},[],['$_']}],table),
  845:     {ok, false, _, _} = erlang:match_spec_test({0,3},[{{<<1,2,3,4>>,'_'},[],['$_']}],table),
  846:     {ok, false, _, _} = erlang:match_spec_test({0,3},[{{make_ref(),'_'},[],['$_']}],table),
  847:     ok.
  848: 
  849: %% Test that faulty seq_trace_call does not crash emulator
  850: faulty_seq_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  851:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  852:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,do_faulty_seq_trace,[]),
  853:     peer:stop(Peer).
  854: 
  855: do_faulty_seq_trace() ->
  856:     {ok,'EXIT',_,_} = erlang:match_spec_test([],[{'_',[],[{message,{set_seq_token,yxa,true}}]}],trace),
  857:     ok.
  858: 
  859: errchk(Pat) ->
  860:     case catch erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE, f2, 2}, Pat) of
  861: 	{'EXIT', {badarg, _}} ->
  862: 	    ok;
  863: 	Other ->
  864: 	    ct:fail({noerror, Other})
  865:     end.
  866: 
  867: %% Checks that unary minus works
  868: unary_minus(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  869:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  870: 			      (5,
  871: 			       [{'$1',
  872: 				 [{'<',{'-','$1'},-4}],
  873: 				 [true]}],
  874: 			       table),
  875:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  876: 			      (5,
  877: 			       [{'$1',
  878: 				 [{'<',{'-','$1'},-6}],
  879: 				 [true]}],
  880: 			       table),
  881:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  882: 			      (5,
  883: 			       [{'$1',
  884: 				 [{'=:=',{'-','$1',2},3}],
  885: 				 [true]}],
  886: 			       table),
  887:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  888: 			      (hej,
  889: 			       [{'$1',
  890: 				 [{'=/=',{'-','$1'},0}],
  891: 				 [true]}],
  892: 			       table),
  893:     ok.
  894: 
  895: %% Checks that unary plus works
  896: unary_plus(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  897:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  898: 			      (5,
  899: 			       [{'$1',
  900: 				 [{'<',{'+','$1'},6}],
  901: 				 [true]}],
  902: 			       table),
  903:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  904: 			      (5,
  905: 			       [{'$1',
  906: 				 [{'<',{'+','$1'},4}],
  907: 				 [true]}],
  908: 			       table),
  909:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  910: 			      (5,
  911: 			       [{'$1',
  912: 				 [{'=:=',{'+','$1',2},7}],
  913: 				 [true]}],
  914: 			       table),
  915:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  916: 			      (hej,
  917: 			       [{'$1',
  918: 				 [{'=/=',{'+','$1'},0}],
  919: 				 [true]}],
  920: 			       table),
  921:     ok.
  922: 
  923: 
  924:     
  925: 
  926: %% Checks that exceptions in guards are handled correctly
  927: guard_exceptions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  928:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  929: 			       (5,
  930: 				[{'$1',
  931: 				  [{'or',{is_integer,'$1'},{'or','$1','$1'}}],
  932: 				  [true]}],
  933: 				table),
  934:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  935: 			       (5,
  936: 				[{'$1',
  937: 				  [{'orelse',{is_integer,'$1'},
  938: 				    {'or','$1','$1'}}],
  939: 				  [true]}],
  940: 				table),
  941:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  942: 			       (5,
  943: 				[{'$1',
  944: 				  [{'orelse',{'or','$1',true},
  945: 				    {is_integer,'$1'}}],
  946: 				  [true]}],
  947: 				table),
  948:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  949: 			       (5,
  950: 				[{'$1',
  951: 				  [{'or',{is_integer,'$1'},
  952: 				    {'orelse','$1',true}}],
  953: 				  [true]}],
  954: 				table),
  955:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  956: 			       (5,
  957: 				[{'$1',
  958: 				  [{'or',{is_integer,'$1'},
  959: 				    {'orelse',true,'$1'}}],
  960: 				  [true]}],
  961: 				table),
  962:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  963: 			       (5,
  964: 				[{'$1',
  965: 				  [{'or',{is_integer,'$1'},
  966: 				    {'andalso',false,'$1'}}],
  967: 				  [true]}],
  968: 				table),
  969:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  970: 			       (5,
  971: 				[{'$1',
  972: 				  [{'or',{is_integer,'$1'},
  973: 				    {'andalso','$1',false}}],
  974: 				  [true]}],
  975: 				table),
  976: 
  977:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test
  978: 			       (5,
  979: 				[{'$1',
  980: 				  [{'or',{is_integer,'$1'},
  981: 				    {'andalso','$1',false}}],
  982: 				  [true]}],
  983: 				table),
  984: 
  985:     ok.
  986: 
  987: %% Checks floating point exceptions in match-specs
  988: fpe(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  989:     MS = [{{'$1'},[],[{'/','$1',0}]}],
  990:     case catch (['EXIT','EXIT'] = 
  991: 		ets:match_spec_run([{1},{2}],ets:match_spec_compile(MS))) of 
  992: 	{'EXIT',_} -> ct:fail({error, "Floating point exceptions faulty"});
  993: 	_ -> ok 
  994:     end.
  995: 
  996: %% Test maps in match-specs
  997: maps(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  998:     {ok,#{},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{}, [{'_',[],['$_']}], table),
  999:     {ok,#{},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{}, [{#{},[],['$_']}], table),
 1000:     {ok,false,[],[]} =
 1001:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{}, [{not_a_map,[],['$_']}], table),
 1002:     {ok,bar,[],[]} =
 1003:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{foo => bar},
 1004:                                [{#{foo => '$1'},[],['$1']}],
 1005:                                table),
 1006:     {ok,false,[],[]} =
 1007:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{foo => bar},
 1008:                                [{#{foo => qux},[],[qux]}],
 1009:                                table),
 1010:     {ok,false,[],[]} =
 1011:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{}, [{#{foo => '_'},[],[foo]}], table),
 1012:     {error,_} =
 1013:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{}, [{#{'$1' => '_'},[],[foo]}], table),
 1014:     {ok,bar,[],[]} =
 1015:         erlang:match_spec_test({#{foo => bar}},
 1016:                                [{{#{foo => '$1'}},[],['$1']}],
 1017:                                table),
 1018:     {ok,#{foo := 3},[],[]} =
 1019:         erlang:match_spec_test({}, [{{},[],[#{foo => {'+',1,2}}]}], table),
 1020: 
 1021:     {ok,"camembert",[],[]} =
 1022:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{b => "camembert",c => "cabcou"},
 1023:                                [{#{b => '$1',c => "cabcou"},[],['$1']}], table),
 1024: 
 1025:     {ok,#{a :="camembert",b := "hi"},[],[]} =
 1026:         erlang:match_spec_test(#{<<"b">> =>"camembert","c"=>"cabcou", "wat"=>"hi", b=><<"other">>},
 1027:                                [{#{<<"b">> => '$1',"wat" => '$2'},[],[#{a=>'$1',b=>'$2'}]}],
 1028:                                table),
 1029: 
 1030:     {ok,1,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[],[{map_size,'$1'}]}],table),
 1031:     {ok,'EXIT',[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(not_a_map, [{'$1',[],[{map_size,'$1'}]}], table),
 1032:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(not_a_map, [{'$1',[{map_size,'$1'}],['$_']}], table),
 1033:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[{'=:=',{map_size,'$1'},1}],[true]}], table),
 1034: 
 1035:     {ok,1,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[],[{map_get,a,'$1'}]}], table),
 1036:     {ok,'EXIT',[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[],[{map_get,b,'$1'}]}], table),
 1037:     {ok,'EXIT',[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(not_a_map, [{'$1',[],[{map_get,b,'$1'}]}], table),
 1038:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[{map_get,b,'$1'}],['$_']}], table),
 1039:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(not_a_map, [{'$1',[{map_get,b,'$1'}],['$_']}], table),
 1040:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => true}, [{'$1',[{map_get,a,'$1'}],[true]}], table),
 1041: 
 1042:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[],[{is_map_key,a,'$1'}]}], table),
 1043:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[],[{is_map_key,b,'$1'}]}], table),
 1044:     {ok,'EXIT',[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(not_a_map, [{'$1',[],[{is_map_key,a,'$1'}]}], table),
 1045:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => 1}, [{'$1',[{is_map_key,b,'$1'}],['$_']}], table),
 1046:     {ok,false,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(not_a_map, [{'$1',[{is_map_key,b,'$1'}],['$_']}], table),
 1047:     {ok,true,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a => true}, [{'$1',[{is_map_key,a,'$1'}],[true]}], table),
 1048: 
 1049:     %% large maps
 1050: 
 1051:     Ls0 = [{I,<<I:32>>}||I <- lists:seq(1,415)],
 1052:     M0  = maps:from_list(Ls0),
 1053:     M1  = #{a=>1,b=>2,c=>3,d=>4},
 1054: 
 1055:     R1  = M0#{263 := #{ a=> 3 }},
 1056:     Ms1 = [{M1#{c:='$1'},[],[M0#{263 := #{a => '$1'}}]}],
 1057: 
 1058:     {ok,R1,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(M1,Ms1,table),
 1059: 
 1060:     Ms2 = [{M0#{63:='$1', 19:='$2'},[],[M0#{19:='$1', 63:='$2'}]}],
 1061:     R2  = M0#{63 := maps:get(19,M0), 19 := maps:get(63,M0) },
 1062:     {ok,R2,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(M0,Ms2,table),
 1063: 
 1064:     ok = maps_check_loop(M1),
 1065:     ok = maps_check_loop(M0),
 1066:     M2 = maps:from_list([{integer_to_list(K),V} || {K,V} <- Ls0]),
 1067:     ok = maps_check_loop(M2),
 1068: 
 1069:     %% Maps in guards
 1070:     {ok,#{a:=1},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>1}, [{'$1',[{'==','$1',#{a=>1}}],['$1']}], table),
 1071:     {ok,#{a:='$1'},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>'$1'}, [{'$1',[{'==','$1',#{a=>{const,'$1'}}}],['$1']}], table),
 1072:     {ok,#{a:=1},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>1}, [{'$1',[{'==','$1',#{{const,a}=>1}}],['$1']}], table),
 1073:     {ok,#{20:=1,b:=2},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test({11,#{20=>1,b=>2}},[{{'$1','$2'},[{'==','$2',#{{'+','$1',9}=>{'-','$1',10},b=>{const,2}}}],['$2']}], table),
 1074:     %% Test that maps with duplicate keys work. This depends on the iteration order of small maps.
 1075:     true = lists:any(
 1076:              fun(N) ->
 1077:                      {ok,#{1=>1,2=>N},[],[]} ==
 1078:                          erlang:match_spec_test(#{1=>1,2=>N},[{'$1',[{'==','$1',#{1=>1,2=>2,{const,2}=>3,{'+',1,1}=>4,{'+',2,0}=>5}}],['$1']}],table)
 1079:              end,[2,3,4,5]),
 1080:     %% Test what happens when a map is collapsed from hash to flatmap
 1081:     {ok,#{0:=1},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{0=>1},[{'$1',[{'==','$1',maps:from_list([{{'-',I,I},1} || I <- lists:seq(1,100)])}],['$1']}], table),
 1082: 
 1083:     %% Large maps in guards
 1084:     {ok,#{a:=1},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(M0#{a=>1}, [{'$1',[{'==','$1',M0#{a=>1}}],['$1']}], table),
 1085:     {ok,#{a:='$1'},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(M0#{a=>'$1'}, [{'$1',[{'==','$1',M0#{a=>{const,'$1'}}}],['$1']}], table),
 1086:     {ok,#{520:=1,b:=2},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test({11,M0#{520=>1,b=>2}},[{{'$1','$2'},[{'==','$2',M0#{{'+','$1',509}=>{'-','$1',10},b=>{const,2}}}],['$2']}], table),
 1087:     %% Test that maps with duplicate keys work. This depends on the iteration order of hash maps.
 1088:     true = lists:any(
 1089:              fun(N) ->
 1090:                      {ok,M0#{1:=1,2:=N},[],[]} == erlang:match_spec_test(M0#{1=>1,2=>N},[{'$1',[{'==','$1',M0#{1=>1,2=>2,{const,2}=>3,{'+',1,1}=>4,{'+',2,0}=>5}}],['$1']}], table)
 1091:              end, [2,3,4,5]),
 1092: 
 1093:     %% Maps in body
 1094:     {ok,#{a:=1,b:=2},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>1},[{#{a=>'$1'},[],[#{a=>'$1',b=>{const,2}}]}], table),
 1095:     {ok,#{a:=1,b:=#{a:='$1'}},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>1},[{#{a=>'$1'},[],[#{a=>'$1',b=>#{a=>{const,'$1'}}}]}], table),
 1096:     {ok,#{a:=1,b:=#{a:='$1'}},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>1},[{#{a=>'$1'},[],[#{a=>'$1',{const,b}=>#{a=>{const,'$1'}}}]}], table),
 1097:     %% Test that maps with duplicate keys work. This depends on the iteration order of small maps.
 1098:     true = lists:any(
 1099:              fun(N) ->
 1100:                      {ok,#{2=>N},[],[]} == erlang:match_spec_test(#{a=>1},[{#{a=>'$1'},[],[#{{'+',3,-1}=>1,2=>2,{const,2}=>3,{'+',1,'$1'}=>4,{'+',2,0}=>5}]}], table)
 1101:              end,[1,2,3,4,5]),
 1102:     %% Test what happens when a map is collapsed from hash to flatmap
 1103:     {ok,#{0:=1},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(#{0=>1},[{'$1',[],[maps:from_list([{{'-',I,I},1} || I <- lists:seq(1,100)])]}], table),
 1104: 
 1105:     %% Large maps in body
 1106:     {ok,#{a:=1,b:=#{a:='$1'}},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(M0#{a=>1},[{#{a=>'$1'},[],[M0#{a=>'$1',b=>M0#{a=>{const,'$1'}}}]}], table),
 1107:     {ok,#{a:=1,b:=#{a:='$1'}},[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(M0#{a=>1},[{#{a=>'$1'},[],[M0#{a=>'$1',{const,b}=>M0#{a=>{const,'$1'}}}]}], table),
 1108:     %% Test that maps with duplicate keys work. This depends on the iteration order of hash maps.
 1109:     true = lists:any(
 1110:              fun(N) ->
 1111:                      {ok,M0#{1:=1,2:=N},[],[]} == erlang:match_spec_test(M0#{1=>1,2=>5},[{'$1',[],[M0#{1=>1,2=>2,{const,2}=>3,{'+',1,1}=>4,{'*',2,1}=>5}]}], table)
 1112:              end,[2,3,4,5]),
 1113: 
 1114:     ok.
 1115: 
 1116: maps_check_loop(M) ->
 1117:     Ks = maps:keys(M),
 1118:     maps_check_loop(M,M,M,M,Ks,lists:reverse(Ks),1).
 1119: 
 1120: maps_check_loop(Orig,M0,MsM0,Rm0,[K|Ks],[Rk|Rks],Ix) ->
 1121:     MsK  = list_to_atom([$$]++integer_to_list(Ix)),
 1122:     MsM1 = MsM0#{K := MsK},
 1123:     Rm1  = Rm0#{Rk := MsK},
 1124:     M1   = M0#{Rk  := maps:get(K,MsM0)},
 1125:     Ms   = [{MsM1,[],[Rm1]}],
 1126:     {ok,M1,[],[]} = erlang:match_spec_test(Orig,Ms,table),
 1127:     maps_check_loop(Orig,M1,MsM1,Rm1,Ks,Rks,Ix+1);
 1128: maps_check_loop(_,_,_,_,[],[],_) -> ok.
 1129: 
 1130: 
 1131: empty_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1132:     Val=[{'$1',[], [{message,'$1'},{message,{caller}},{return_trace}]}],
 1133:      %% Did crash debug VM in faulty assert:
 1134:     erlang:match_spec_test([],Val,trace).
 1135: 
 1136: moving_labels(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1137:     %% Force an andalso/orelse construction to be moved by placing it
 1138:     %% in a tuple followed by a constant term. Labels should still
 1139:     %% point at their correct target.
 1140:     %% 
 1141:     Ms = [{{'$1','$2'},[],[{{ok,{'andalso','$1','$2'},[1,2,3]}}]}],
 1142:     {ok,{ok,false,[1,2,3]},[],[]} =
 1143: 	erlang:match_spec_test({true,false}, Ms, table),
 1144: 
 1145:     Ms2 = [{{'$1','$2'},[],[{{ok,{'orelse','$1','$2'},[1,2,3]}}]}],
 1146:     {ok,{ok,true,[1,2,3]},[],[]} =
 1147: 	erlang:match_spec_test({true,false}, Ms2, table),
 1148: 
 1149:     ok.
 1150: 
 1151: -record(dummy_record, {}).
 1152: 
 1153: %% GH-7045: Some guard BIFs were unavailable in match specifications.
 1154: guard_bifs(_Config) ->
 1155:     Matches =
 1156:         [begin
 1157:              BIF = list_to_tuple([F | lists:duplicate(A, '$1')]),
 1158:              erlang:match_spec_test(Data, [{{'$1'}, [BIF], [{{'$1'}}]}], Kind)
 1159:          end
 1160:          || {F, A} <- erlang:module_info(functions),
 1161:             {Data, Kind} <- [{{a}, table}, {[a], trace}],
 1162:             F =/= is_record, %% Has special requirements, checked below.
 1163:             erl_internal:arith_op(F, A) orelse
 1164:                 erl_internal:bool_op(F, A) orelse
 1165:                 erl_internal:comp_op(F, A) orelse
 1166:                 erl_internal:guard_bif(F, A)],
 1167:     [] = [T || {error, _}=T <- Matches],
 1168: 
 1169:     IsRecord = {is_record,
 1170:                 '$1',
 1171:                 dummy_record,
 1172:                 record_info(size, dummy_record)},
 1173:     [{ok, _, [], []} =
 1174:          erlang:match_spec_test(Data, [{{'$1'}, [IsRecord], [{{'$1'}}]}], Kind)
 1175:      || {Data, Kind} <- [{{#dummy_record{}}, table},
 1176:                          {[#dummy_record{}], trace}]],
 1177: 
 1178:     ok.
 1179: 
 1180: tr(Fun, MFA, Pat, Expected) ->
 1181:     tr(Fun, MFA, [call], Pat, [global], Expected).
 1182: 
 1183: tr(Fun, MFA, TraceFlags, Pat, PatFlags, Expected0) ->
 1184:     tr(Fun,
 1185:        fun(P) ->
 1186:                erlang:trace(P, true, TraceFlags),
 1187:                erlang:trace_pattern(MFA, Pat, PatFlags),
 1188:                lists:map(
 1189:                  fun(X) when is_function(X,1) -> X;
 1190:                     (X) -> list_to_tuple([trace, P | tuple_to_list(X)])
 1191:                  end,
 1192:                  Expected0)
 1193:        end).
 1194: 
 1195: tr(RunFun, ControlFun) ->
 1196:     P = spawn_link(?MODULE, runner, [self(), RunFun]),
 1197:     collect(P, ControlFun(P)).
 1198: 
 1199: collect(P, TMs) ->
 1200:     start_collect(P),
 1201:     collect(TMs),
 1202:     stop_collect(P).
 1203: 
 1204: collect([]) ->
 1205:     receive
 1206: 	M ->
 1207: 	    io:format("Got unexpected: ~p~n", [M]),
 1208: 	    flush({got_unexpected,M})
 1209:     after 17 ->
 1210: 	    ok
 1211:     end;
 1212: collect([TM | TMs]) ->
 1213:     io:format(        "Expecting:      ~p~n", [TM]),
 1214:     receive
 1215:         %% We only look at trace messages with the same tracee
 1216:         %% as the message we are looking for. This because
 1217:         %% the order of trace messages is only guaranteed from
 1218:         %% within a single process.
 1219: 	M0 when element(2, M0) =:= element(2, TM); is_function(TM, 1) ->
 1220: 	    M = case element(1, M0) of
 1221: 		    trace_ts ->
 1222: 			list_to_tuple(lists:reverse(
 1223: 					tl(lists:reverse(tuple_to_list(M0)))));
 1224: 		    _ -> M0
 1225: 		end,
 1226: 	    case is_function(TM,1) of
 1227: 		true ->
 1228: 		    case (catch TM(M)) of
 1229: 			true ->
 1230: 			    io:format("Got:            ~p~n", [M]),
 1231: 			    collect(TMs);
 1232: 			_ ->
 1233: 			    io:format("Got unexpected: ~p~n", [M]),
 1234: 			    flush({got_unexpected,M})
 1235: 		    end;
 1236: 
 1237: 		false ->
 1238: 		    case M of
 1239: 			TM ->
 1240: 			    io:format("Got:            ~p~n", [M]),
 1241: 			    collect(TMs);
 1242: 			_ ->
 1243: 			    io:format("Got unexpected: ~p~n", [M]),
 1244: 			    flush({got_unexpected,M})
 1245: 		    end
 1246: 	    end
 1247:     after 15000 ->
 1248:             flush(timeout)
 1249:     end.
 1250: 
 1251: flush(Reason) ->
 1252:     receive
 1253:         M ->
 1254:             io:format("In queue:       ~p~n", [M]),
 1255:             flush(Reason)
 1256:     after 17 ->
 1257:               ct:fail(Reason)
 1258:     end.
 1259: 
 1260: start_collect(P) ->
 1261:     P ! {go, self()}.
 1262: 
 1263: stop_collect(P) ->
 1264:     stop_collect(P, done).
 1265: stop_collect(P, Order) ->
 1266:     P ! {Order, self()},
 1267:     receive
 1268:         {gone, P} ->
 1269:             ok
 1270:     end.
 1271: 
 1272: 
 1273: runner(Collector, Fun) ->
 1274:     receive
 1275:         {go, Collector} ->
 1276:             go
 1277:     end,
 1278:     Fun(),
 1279:     receive
 1280:         {done, Collector} ->
 1281:             Collector ! {gone, self()}
 1282:     end.
 1283: 
 1284: loop_runner(Collector, Fun, Laps) ->
 1285:     receive
 1286:         {go, Collector} ->
 1287:             go
 1288:     end,
 1289:     loop_runner_cont(Collector, Fun, 0, Laps).
 1290: 
 1291: loop_runner_cont(Collector, _Fun, Laps, Laps) ->
 1292:     receive
 1293:         {done, Collector} -> ok;
 1294:         {abort, Collector} -> ok
 1295:     end,
 1296:     io:format("loop_runner ~p exit after ~p laps\n", [self(), Laps]),
 1297:     Collector ! {gone, self()};
 1298: 
 1299: loop_runner_cont(Collector, Fun, N, Laps) ->
 1300:     Fun(),
 1301:     receive
 1302:         {abort, Collector} ->
 1303:             io:format("loop_runner ~p aborted after ~p of ~p laps\n", [self(), N+1, Laps]),
 1304:             Collector ! {gone, self()}
 1305:     after 0 ->
 1306:               loop_runner_cont(Collector, Fun, N+1, Laps)
 1307:     end.
 1308: 
 1309: 
 1310: f1(X) ->
 1311:     {X}.
 1312: 
 1313: f2(X, Y) ->
 1314:     {X, Y}.
 1315: 
 1316: f3(X,Y) ->
 1317:     ?MODULE:f2(X,Y),
 1318:     ok.
 1319: 
 1320: fn(X) ->
 1321:     [X].
 1322: fn(X, Y) ->
 1323:     [X, Y].
 1324: fn(X, Y, Z) ->
 1325:     [X, Y, Z].
 1326: 
 1327: fbinmatch(<<Int, Rest/binary>>, Acc) ->
 1328:     fbinmatch(Rest, [?MODULE:f1(Int) | Acc]);
 1329: fbinmatch(<<>>, Acc) -> Acc.
 1330: 
 1331: id(X) ->
 1332:     X.
 1333: 
 1334: -file("test4.erl", 1).
 1335: f3_test4(X,Y) ->
 1336:     ?MODULE:f2_test4(X,Y), % Line 3 - This line number should remain stable
 1337:     ok.
 1338: 
 1339: f2_test4(X, _) ->
 1340:     ?MODULE:f1_test4(X).
 1341: 
 1342: f1_test4(X) ->
 1343:     {X}.
